suncertify.gui
Class NetworkClientView

java.lang.Object
  java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
          java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
              suncertify.gui.NetworkClientView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, RemoteObserver
public class NetworkClientView
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements RemoteObserver

The view for the network client, wrapping the client main frame as the window actually being displayed. Creates and displays the client main frame, connects to the contractor manager based on the information retrieved from the likewise-managed configuration parameters dialog, and performs an initial search to display the whole contents of the database.

This NetworkClientView has been made an observer getting notified automatically when the server shuts down.

Due to the thin client design approach, this view plays the combined roles of the view as well as the controller in the model-view-controller (MVC) setting.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner
See Also:
StandaloneClientView, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

NetworkClientView

public NetworkClientView()
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Creates a new network client view and displays it. Displays a NetworkClientParametersDialog on top of it and tries to establish a connection to the server until successful, or exits. If successfully connected to the server, performs a search for all records in the database and populates the table accordingly.

Unlike the StandaloneClientView, the network client view acts as a remote observer. The only change observed, however, is a server shutdown. In particular, database changes are not automatically communicated from the server down to its network clients, as might be expected. However, it is easily possible to get a current snapshot of the database by manually repeating the last search operation. This is done automatically after each book operation.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
Method Detail

update

public final void update(RemoteObservable obs,
                         java.lang.Object arg)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Called from the server application when the server is about to be shutting down. Causes the client main frame to deactivate itself so that exit is the only possible operation left enabled.

Specified by:
update in interface RemoteObserver
Parameters:
obs - the observable object
arg - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observer.update(java.util.Observable, Object)
